Derfor er indsigt nøgleordet hos Sensu - indsigt i mennesker og indsigt i virksomheder. Vi rådgiver med hjerte, hjerne og passion. Vi går længere og vi går dybere. Vi skaber værdi og vi forstår. JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
HR MANAGER

Aalborg Portland A/S is headquartered in Aalborg, Denmark, which is wholly owned by Cementir Group N.V. The parent company of Aalborg Portland, Cementir, is headquartered partly in Amsterdam, Netherlands and Rome, Italy, and has production facilities in 18 countries on five continents, employing over 3,000 people worldwide. The company is organized on a regional basis, consisting of seven geographical areas, namely: Nordic & Baltic, Belgium & France, North America, Turkey, Egypt, Asia Pacific, and Italy. As one of the leading producers of cement and related products, Cementir has an annual production capacity of 13 million tons of concrete and cement.

 Nordic & Baltic Region consists of Aalborg Portland A/S and Unicon A/S. Aalborg Portland A/S is a leading cement producer in the Nordic Region and produces both grey and white cement at their factory in Aalborg. The products are sold in Denmark, the USA and adjacent countries. Unicon A/S is a supplier of ready-mixed concrete and the market leader in the Nordic region. Production takes place at 80 factories in Denmark, Norway and Sweden. Quarry work and sales of aggregates (primarily granite and gravel) take place from 15 sites in Denmark and Sweden.

 Aalborg Portland, Nordic & Baltic Region employs a total of 920 employees - of which 770 in based Denmark. 

You can read more about the company here:  https://aalborgportlandholding.com/en

To further support and develop HR in Aalborg Portland, we are currently seeking an experienced and dedicated HR Manager

Global market leader – HR generalist – Strategic key role

Do you want to be a part of an international company and play a key role in further increasing the business value of HR? We are looking for an HR Manager for Aalborg Portland A/S who will play a pivotal role in further increasing the business value of HR. You will be part of a professional HR team consisting of both HR Specialists and HR Operations and report directly to the Regional HR Director, where you will experience an ambitious and professional company which is characterised by an informal and dynamic work environment with a focus on personal and professional development.

You will play a pivotal role in an International Group, as a member of the Regional HR team. Here you will work with all areas of HR - from ensuring high quality of master data to support of organisational development processes and you will act as a vital link between employees and management. Your role is characterised by a large span of tasks covering both strategical, operational and project tasks which to a great extent is interdependent. Some of your assignments will be to implement HR initiatives to enhance leadership, competences, and organisational development to ensure the implementation of business strategy. Further, you will also drive HR agenda, be the key HR contact person as well as oversee all human resource operations and ensure they are aligned with Aalborg Portland’s business goals, take ownership of labor law, and ensure compliance with Global HR policies and principles supported by Regional and Group HR.

You will analyze and define organizational capabilities and capacity by driving organizational reviews, ad hoc people assessment, talent identification. You will implement and facilitate HR annual activities in coordination with Regional and Global HR team as well as ensure overview and control of HR costs and reporting to local, regional, and group management.

You will manage industrial relations considering local union negotiations, contact to union representatives together with Line Managers etc. You will work with the entire recruitment process as well as support and advice managers in relations to recruitment and onboarding. In general, you will provide high levels of support and advise to line managers and management drawing on sound knowledge of company policy, labour law and best practices.

To be successful as a HR manager you have a master’s degree within HRM, business, psychology, social science, or other relevant discipline as well as at least 8 years of experience in HR and solid experience in developing organisations within an international context. You have proven experience working in a blue-collar and unionised environment, experience in negotiating with unions as well as a solid understanding of Danish Labour Law. You have a good economical foundation combined with a solid business understanding making you a strong strategic business partner for the management. You have strong interpersonal capabilities that enable the balance between challenging, advising and supporting management and line managers. It is an advantage if you have experience with SAP HR, SuccesFactors or Focused. We expect you to be fluent in both Danish and English.

You are characterised by a natural authority with a pragmatic and strategic mindset. You have a structured and ambitious way of working and you drive change through your solution-oriented and hands-on approach. You are team-oriented with an excellent ability to build strong and trusted relations with many stakeholders inside the organisation. You are a strong communicator who uses your empathy and diplomacy to manage and adapt your communicative style depending on the environment and recipients. You thrive in a busy and dynamic environment and seamlessly adapt to new directions and ways of working.

Are you the new HR manager in Aalborg Portland A/S? Please apply by uploading your application and resume in English. For further information regarding the position, please contact Sensu A/S, Maiken Dehn Larsen at.: +45 27 50 56 06.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we process the applications continuously.
